text: The Barawa (B.3 West Chadic) languages are a branch of West Chadic languages. They are spoken in the Bauchi State of North Nigeria. ==Languages== The Barawa languages are:Blench, Roger. 2006. The Afro-Asiatic Languages: Classification and Reference List (ms) ;Barawa *Zaar: Dass; Geji, Polci (Polchi), Saya, Zari, Zeem *Guruntum: Guruntum-Mbaaru, Ju, Tala, Zangwal *Boghom: Jimi, Jum; Boghom, Kir-Balar, Mangas ==References== Category:West Chadic languages Category:Languages of Nigeria
title: Barawa languages
